column1: Back in the sixties, "Safety Fast" was the essence of MG

Potential customers can read the protocols on the Failte Ireland site listed under Guidelines for reopening and this may reassure them that the providers of the resource have some understanding of the safety measures that need to be adhered to.The rest is up to the customer...wash your hands frequently, use the sanitiser provided by the premises and be careful about social distancing...and then enjoy the holiday

I don’t see how we can relax and enjoy the holidays when people travelling from the U.K. and US will be using these same establishments. Failte Ireland can’t have it both ways imo.Edited: 7:07 am, July 10, 2020

I am not interested in having anything out with anyone, especially people who have posts removed in a cowardly fashion and tell others to ignore my posts as if they weren't capable of deciding for themselves. Forums of any nature are about different opinions, experiences and perspectives - many contributors on here either don't get (or want to accept )that. The majority of regulars here share the same perspectives as well as tolerating off-topic chat amongst each other followed by back-slapping. As soon as someone strays from the general narrative the cowardly act of banding together and reporting posts happens. In some cases they refer to someone who would dare stray from the back-slapping narrative as a troll. What I stated about American tourists was referred to by other regulars also but their contributions were tolerated. This issue has been well reported in the media and on here and I stand over everything I said. Most of Europe has banned flights from America because of how badly Trump has handled the situation over there. Americans who fly here during a pandemic are likely Trump voters and tens of millions of Americans voted for him in the last election. This has nothing to do with anti-American sentiment, it is to do with behaviour and public health awareness.
